dict.string: fulminate
verb
Flash like lightening. Make loud or violent verbal attacks
The entire assembly was shocked by the reporter's sudden fulminatory remarks at the minister
flagrant
adjective
Glaring, Notorious, Scandalous (of offence or offender). Conspicuously bad
Jason is a flagrant liar and does not hesitate before talking ill about anyone.
facetious
adjective
Addicted to or marked by pleasantry or levity
Gary has this facetious habit of passing silly remarks, which can get very irritating at times
factitious
adjective
Unnatural, Made for a special purpose
The hotel ordered factitious red flowers made of paper to decorate its lobby for Christmas
fetish
noun
An object of unreasonable affection or reverence
Selia is too fetish about her cat and even takes her along to parties
